		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1283" class="post-1283 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #122 / October 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					In this time of illness, cynicism and cruelty, do you receive many mean or vile messages? How do you cope with that kind of negative energy?				</h1>
				<h3>PAT, CHICAGO, USA</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/cope-with-negative-energy/" title="In this time of illness, cynicism and cruelty, do you receive many mean or vile messages? How do you cope with that kind of negative energy?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-4.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-4.png 828w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-4-250x141.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-4-768x432.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-4-700x394.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-4-120x68.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 828px) 100vw, 828px" />							</a>
														<p style="text-align: center;">
							'WE MUST LOVE ONE ANOTHER OR DIE' W. H. AUDEN							</p>
												<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Dear Pat,</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">The letters sent to </span><em><span lang="DE">The Red Hand Files</span></em><span lang="EN-US"> are mostly beautiful, full of love and a joy to read, but I do get the odd unkind message. Generally, though, I like them and find them weirdly energising. There is nothing quite like a good death threat in the morning to get the juices flowing. They are a form of validation, really, as </span><span lang="EN-US">no one with a public platform and an opinion is doing his or her job effectively if they are not being attacked from time to time.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Having said that, Pat, when you say that we are living in a </span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">‘</span><span lang="EN-US">time of cynicism and cruelty</span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">’</span><span lang="EN-US">, I am not sure I agree with you. I think we are living through a frightening and deeply uncertain time, and though there are dementing and cynical voices out there, which are being emboldened and amplified by social media — that loony engine of outrage — they do not represent the voices of the many, or the good. My experience of <em>actual people</em> in this time is overwhelmingly positive — there is a great deal of love and mutual regard and community. I think most of us understand that in order to rise above this particular moment we must pull together, and act with civility, generosity and kindness. We have a monumental task ahead of us that will require vast reserves of energy — we must rehabilitate the world — and this fellow feeling and mutual respect is essential to the process.</span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">Of course, there is much in our world that is in need of change, to be set to rights, and clearly humanity is complex, conflicted and full of faults, but at this moment in time, when our very existence hangs in the balance, we need to come together not just in good faith and consolation, but also in a spirit of creativity and invention. </span><span lang="EN-US">Our existence depends upon offering the best of ourselves. Negativity, cynicism and resentment will not do. </span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">‘</span><span lang="EN-US">We must love one another or die.</span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">’</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="NL">Love, Nick </span></p>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

As a recovering heroin addict, I am having difficulty getting into the Narcotics Anonymous scene. I see how it can help but I feel as if many people replaced doing drugs with talking about when they used to do drugs. I am trying to find a good support system but it is hard. Perhaps I am being too cynical and not giving it a chance? Do you have any more advice for a recovering heroin user?">‘What do you think about NA? 		<title>Nick Cave - The Red Hand Files - Issue #121 - In an interview from 1997 in Los Angeles, you introduced us to your &quot;pet theory&quot;: your creativity could only flourish in a state of loss and longing, and that it needed catastrophes in your life. Finally, and this is what resonated with me the most, you stated that you could not get much substance out of living a life which was content. Do you still believe that? A sincere and devoted admirer of yours who sort of struggles in a content life. : The Red Hand Files</title>

	<!-- section -->
	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1276" class="post-1276 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #121 / October 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					In an interview from 1997 in Los Angeles, you introduced us to your &#8220;pet theory&#8221;: your creativity could only flourish in a state of loss and longing, and that it needed catastrophes in your life. <br> Finally, and this is what resonated with me the most, you stated that you could not get much substance out of living a life which was content. Do you still believe that? <br> A sincere and devoted admirer of yours who sort of struggles in a content life.				</h1>
				<h3>HYUN, SEOUL, SOUTH KOREA</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/pet-theory-your-creativity-flourish/" title="In an interview from 1997 in Los Angeles, you introduced us to your &#8220;pet theory&#8221;: your creativity could only flourish in a state of loss and longing, and that it needed catastrophes in your life.  Finally, and this is what resonated with me the most, you stated that you could not get much substance out of living a life which was content. Do you still believe that?  A sincere and devoted admirer of yours who sort of struggles in a content life.">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/d7hftxdivxxvm.cloudfront.jpeg" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/d7hftxdivxxvm.cloudfront.jpeg 619w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/d7hftxdivxxvm.cloudfront-250x194.jpeg 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/d7hftxdivxxvm.cloudfront-120x93.jpeg 120w" sizes="(max-width: 619px) 100vw, 619px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">Dear Hyun,</span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">One of the truly humbling aspects of <em>The Red Hand Files</em> is the glimpse it has given me into the vast and varied sweep of human suffering. Letter after letter comes in, day after day, increasingly so during the pandemic and its recurring lockdowns, from people suffering </span><span lang="EN-US">distress due to very serious problems</span><span lang="EN-US"> — mental health issues, loneliness, homelessness, physical and mental abuse, loss of jobs, loss of loved ones, loss of dreams, loss of </span><span lang="EN-US">meaning and loss of hope.</span><span lang="EN-US"> It is a profound privilege to read these letters as it puts one</span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">’</span><span lang="EN-US">s own struggles into perspective, and is a reminder that despite our differences, no one is immune to suffering. </span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">So, when I read the quote from a younger Nick Cave saying he needs catastrophes in his life to create, these words sound somewhat like the indulgent posturing of a man yet to discover the devastating effect true suffering can have on our ability to function, let alone to create. I am not only talking about personal grief, but also </span><span lang="DE">global grief, </span><span lang="EN-US">as the world is plunged deeper into this wretched pandemic. The </span><span lang="EN-US">pandemic is playing havoc with our</span><span lang="EN-US"> lives &#8211; but so is the questionable response of the lockdowns. The letters I receive through <em>The Red Hand Files</em> are testament to the devastating and largely ignored effect of lockdowns, not just on the economy, but on the very soul of the world. From reading the data — and I say this with great caution — one can</span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">’</span><span lang="EN-US">t help but wonder if the collateral damage from the </span><span lang="EN-US">lockdowns, this</span><span lang="EN-US"> closeting of our lives, will end up outweighing the benefits.  </span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">Hyun, if you are living a life that is content my advice is to learn to live inside it, examine it, relish it, and most of all <em>remember it</em> — this extraordinary thing, a happy life — because there may come a time when something will present itself in the form of a misfortune, a transgression, an abuse, a failure, a humiliation, a loss, or, indeed, a global crisis where your life will turn, in an instant, from easy comfort to total chaos. It is happening all around us.</span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">On one level, some of this incoming despair is the routine devastation of ordinary life — suffering is always with us. </span><span lang="EN-US">Still, I pray that, ultimately, we will step beyond this extraordinary harrowing of our time to a new way, a different way, a better way. </span><span lang="EN-US">I hope we will be afforded that opportunity.  </span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">Love, Nick </span></p>
<div></div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

I see how it can help but I feel as if many people replaced doing drugs with talking about when they used to do drugs. I am trying to find a good support system but it is hard. Perhaps I am being too cynical and not giving it a chance? Do you have any more advice for a recovering heroin user?" />
<meta name="twitter:image" content="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-2.png" />

			</header>

	<main role="main" aria-label="Content">
	<!-- section -->
	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1273" class="post-1273 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #120 / October 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					What do you think about NA? As a recovering heroin addict, I am having difficulty getting into the Narcotics Anonymous scene. I see how it can help but I feel as if many people replaced doing drugs with talking about when they used to do drugs. I am trying to find a good support system but it is hard. Perhaps I am being too cynical and not giving it a chance? Do you have any more advice for a recovering heroin user?				</h1>
				<h3>EVAN, PORTLAND, USA</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/what-do-you-think-about-na/" title="What do you think about NA? As a recovering heroin addict, I am having difficulty getting into the Narcotics Anonymous scene. I see how it can help but I feel as if many people replaced doing drugs with talking about when they used to do drugs. I am trying to find a good support system but it is hard. Perhaps I am being too cynical and not giving it a chance? Do you have any more advice for a recovering heroin user?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-2.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-2.png 826w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-2-250x186.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-2-768x571.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-2-700x520.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-2-120x89.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 826px) 100vw, 826px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p>Dear Evan,</p>
<p>Personally, I have a lot of time for Narcotics Anonymous, but I do understand your resistance to the idea. I was the same. In my heart I never really got it — never felt the same connection other people seemed to have. I always felt outside the idea, looking in. I could never fully commit.</p>
<p>However, I think it would be fair to say if it weren’t for NA I probably wouldn’t have survived my heroin addiction. Narcotics Anonymous was this <em>thing</em>, steady and ever-present, that just never ever went away, a place I could come crawling back to, again and again, year after year, and be accepted and <em>welcomed,</em> welcomed back in. In this respect I owe Narcotics Anonymous my life. When no one else would have me, Narcotics Anonymous always would.</p>
<p>The basis of Narcotics Anonymous, the Twelve Steps, a series of suggestions as to how to live a life — the original ‘antidote to chaos’ — seems to me to be an extraordinarily effective way to navigate the world, for all people, addicts or otherwise. Having said that, I do not follow The Twelve Steps myself, to my detriment I would say. Doubtless, I would be a better person if I did.</p>
<p>In the end you find your own way. Ultimately I found mine outside of NA, with my wife, but it took Narcotics Anonymous to show me the way.</p>
<p>Reading your letter again, Evan, my advice to you — and to me — go to a fucking meeting.</p>
<p>Love, Nick</p>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

Do you still believe that? <br> A sincere and devoted admirer of yours who sort of struggles in a content life.">‘In an interview from 1997 in Los Angeles, you introduced us to your &#8220;pet theory&#8221;: your creativity could only flourish in a state of loss and longing, and that it needed ...’</a></h5>

SOURCE: https://www.theredhandfiles.com/i-could-physically-sense-and-see-the-ghosteen/
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en-AU" class="no-js">
	<head>
		<meta charset="UTF-8">
		<title>Nick Cave - The Red Hand Files - Issue #119 - I was thinking how much I wish I could write this story to you in Greek, my native language. In June one of my best friends suddenly died aged 46. He was a sailing buddy for about 20 years, since I was 18. We have sailed up and down the Aegean Sea for thousands of miles. We had booked a sailing yacht for the whole of August, just the two of us, to go sailing in the deserted - due to Covid - Aegean. He was getting married in September, and this was meant to be our own, peculiar, spiritual, bachelor party. We would take with us our music, our books and our drugs. And we would sail where the wind took us. When August came, I decided to go ahead with the journey on my own. I nailed a picture of him, Fotis, on the cockpit and begun alone, though many friends wanted to come along. But I wanted no crew. I felt somewhat like Ahab beginning a doomed voyage. I thought I should spare any crew. I took with me 4 full discographies. Yours, Pink Floyd, Radiohead, and the greatest Greek of the 20th century, Savvopoulos. And two books, Moby Dick by Melville, and Odyssey by Homer. A week in the journey this happened. I was doing a long night sail. I always enjoy night sails. The wind was light and fair, no land or human in sight. No sound from an engine but the sails gently flapping in the wind, and the bow slowly advancing through the water. I was traversing a large stretch of water eastwards, from Mykonos to Patmos. The Milky Way was shining on top of me like a crown of all that has ever been. Ghosteen was on the speakers. I was having my coffee and my morning joint (you will hopefully not share this with the Hellenic coast guard!) all alone in the very first light. As the sun begun to break from the horizon (as I was travelling eastward), Galleon Ship entered. I stood there, all alone, watching a thousand-galleon ships sailing, &quot;ghostly around the morning sun.&quot; I broke down. I was overwhelmed. It brought me to my knees. I was kneeling in the cockpit, in the twilight, moving slowly towards the sun, crying my heart out. The closest to a prayer a non-believer can experience. And then of course, the way you have the album arranged, Ghosteen started speaking to me. I am beside you I am beside you Look for me Suddenly everything made sense. I could physically sense and see the Ghosteen. Everyone singing to be free, broke free. I could almost physically sense all that has ever been, and all that will ever be. Everything had somehow clicked in my head. Loss was okay. It was only part of the game. The beauty of it all came in the foreground. I rose up and smiled at the emerging sun. So I guess all I&#039;m trying to say is this: 1) I want you to know I can see and sense the Ghosteen. It will be with me forever. Until I close my eyes. 2) Thank you. : The Red Hand Files</title>

		<link href="//www.google-analytics.com" rel="dns-prefetch">
		<link href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/themes/red-hand-files/dist/img/icons/favicon.ico" rel="shortcut icon">
		<link href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/themes/red-hand-files/dist/img/icons/touch.png" rel="apple-touch-icon-precomposed">
		<link rel="alternate" type="application/rss+xml" title="The Red Hand Files" href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/feed/" />

		<meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge,chrome=1">
		<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
		<meta name="description" content="You can ask me anything. There will be no moderator. This will be between you and me. Let&#039;s see what happens. Much love, Nick">

<meta property="og:site_name" content="The Red Hand Files" />
<meta property="article:section" content="Uncategorised" />
<meta property="article:published_time" content="2020-10-09T14:31:23+00:00" />
<meta property="article:modified_time" content="2020-10-09T14:32:43+00:00" />
<meta property="og:updated_time" content="2020-10-09T14:32:43+00:00" />
<meta property="og:image" content="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-1.png" />
<meta property="og:image:secure_url" content="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-1.png" />
<meta property="og:image:width" content="830" />
<meta property="og:image:height" content="550" />
<meta name="twitter:card" content="summary_large_image" />
<meta name="twitter:description" content="Dear Stathis, You Greeks are the best. Love, Nick" />
<meta name="twitter:title" content="Nick Cave - The Red Hand Files - Issue #119 - I was thinking how much I wish I could write this story to you in Greek, my native language. In June one of my best friends suddenly died aged 46. He was a sailing buddy for about 20 years, since I was 18. We have sailed up and down the Aegean Sea for thousands of miles. We had booked a sailing yacht for the whole of August, just the two of us, to go sailing in the deserted - due to Covid - Aegean. He was getting married in September, and this was meant to be our own, peculiar, spiritual, bachelor party. We would take with us our music, our books and our drugs. And we would sail where the wind took us. When August came, I decided to go ahead with the journey on my own. I nailed a picture of him, Fotis, on the cockpit and begun alone, though many friends wanted to come along. But I wanted no crew. I felt somewhat like Ahab beginning a doomed voyage. I thought I should spare any crew. I took with me 4 full discographies. Yours, Pink Floyd, Radiohead, and the greatest Greek of the 20th century, Savvopoulos. And two books, Moby Dick by Melville, and Odyssey by Homer. A week in the journey this happened. I was doing a long night sail. I always enjoy night sails. The wind was light and fair, no land or human in sight. No sound from an engine but the sails gently flapping in the wind, and the bow slowly advancing through the water. I was traversing a large stretch of water eastwards, from Mykonos to Patmos. The Milky Way was shining on top of me like a crown of all that has ever been. Ghosteen was on the speakers. I was having my coffee and my morning joint (you will hopefully not share this with the Hellenic coast guard!) all alone in the very first light. As the sun begun to break from the horizon (as I was travelling eastward), Galleon Ship entered. I stood there, all alone, watching a thousand-galleon ships sailing, &quot;ghostly around the morning sun.&quot; I broke down. I was overwhelmed. It brought me to my knees. I was kneeling in the cockpit, in the twilight, moving slowly towards the sun, crying my heart out. The closest to a prayer a non-believer can experience. And then of course, the way you have the album arranged, Ghosteen started speaking to me. I am beside you I am beside you Look for me Suddenly everything made sense. I could physically sense and see the Ghosteen. Everyone singing to be free, broke free. I could almost physically sense all that has ever been, and all that will ever be. Everything had somehow clicked in my head. Loss was okay. It was only part of the game. The beauty of it all came in the foreground. I rose up and smiled at the emerging sun. So I guess all I&#039;m trying to say is this: 1) I want you to know I can see and sense the Ghosteen. It will be with me forever. Until I close my eyes. 2) Thank you." />
<meta name="twitter:image" content="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-1.png" />

	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1264" class="post-1264 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #119 / October 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					I was thinking how much I wish I could write this story to you in Greek, my native language. <br><br> In June one of my best friends suddenly died aged 46. He was a sailing buddy for about 20 years, since I was 18. We have sailed up and down the Aegean Sea for thousands of miles. We had booked a sailing yacht for the whole of August, just the two of us, to go sailing in the deserted &#8211; due to Covid &#8211; Aegean. He was getting married in September, and this was meant to be our own, peculiar, spiritual, bachelor party. We would take with us our music, our books and our drugs. And we would sail where the wind took us. When August came, I decided to go ahead with the journey on my own. I nailed a picture of him, Fotis, on the cockpit and begun alone, though many friends wanted to come along. But I wanted no crew. I felt somewhat like Ahab beginning a doomed voyage. I thought I should spare any crew. <br><br> I took with me 4 full discographies. Yours, Pink Floyd, Radiohead, and the greatest Greek of the 20th century, Savvopoulos. And two books, Moby Dick by Melville, and Odyssey by Homer. <br><br> A week in the journey this happened. I was doing a long night sail. I always enjoy night sails. The wind was light and fair, no land or human in sight. No sound from an engine but the sails gently flapping in the wind, and the bow slowly advancing through the water. I was traversing a large stretch of water eastwards, from Mykonos to Patmos. The Milky Way was shining on top of me like a crown of all that has ever been. Ghosteen was on the speakers. I was having my coffee and my morning joint (you will hopefully not share this with the Hellenic coast guard!) all alone in the very first light. <br><br> As the sun begun to break from the horizon (as I was travelling eastward), Galleon Ship entered. I stood there, all alone, watching a thousand-galleon ships sailing, &#8220;ghostly around the morning sun.&#8221; <br><br> I broke down. I was overwhelmed. It brought me to my knees. I was kneeling in the cockpit, in the twilight, moving slowly towards the sun, crying my heart out. The closest to a prayer a non-believer can experience. <br><br> And then of course, the way you have the album arranged, Ghosteen started speaking to me.<br><br> I am beside you <br>I am beside you <br>Look for me <br><br> Suddenly everything made sense. I could physically sense and see the Ghosteen. Everyone singing to be free, broke free. I could almost physically sense all that has ever been, and all that will ever be. Everything had somehow clicked in my head. Loss was okay. It was only part of the game. The beauty of it all came in the foreground. I rose up and smiled at the emerging sun. <br><br> So I guess all I&#8217;m trying to say is this: <br><br> 1) I want you to know I can see and sense the Ghosteen. It will be with me forever. Until I close my eyes. <br><br> 2) Thank you.				</h1>
				<h3>STATHIS, ATHENS, GREECE</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/i-could-physically-sense-and-see-the-ghosteen/" title="I was thinking how much I wish I could write this story to you in Greek, my native language.  In June one of my best friends suddenly died aged 46. He was a sailing buddy for about 20 years, since I was 18. We have sailed up and down the Aegean Sea for thousands of miles. We had booked a sailing yacht for the whole of August, just the two of us, to go sailing in the deserted &#8211; due to Covid &#8211; Aegean. He was getting married in September, and this was meant to be our own, peculiar, spiritual, bachelor party. We would take with us our music, our books and our drugs. And we would sail where the wind took us. When August came, I decided to go ahead with the journey on my own. I nailed a picture of him, Fotis, on the cockpit and begun alone, though many friends wanted to come along. But I wanted no crew. I felt somewhat like Ahab beginning a doomed voyage. I thought I should spare any crew.  I took with me 4 full discographies. Yours, Pink Floyd, Radiohead, and the greatest Greek of the 20th century, Savvopoulos. And two books, Moby Dick by Melville, and Odyssey by Homer.  A week in the journey this happened. I was doing a long night sail. I always enjoy night sails. The wind was light and fair, no land or human in sight. No sound from an engine but the sails gently flapping in the wind, and the bow slowly advancing through the water. I was traversing a large stretch of water eastwards, from Mykonos to Patmos. The Milky Way was shining on top of me like a crown of all that has ever been. Ghosteen was on the speakers. I was having my coffee and my morning joint (you will hopefully not share this with the Hellenic coast guard!) all alone in the very first light.  As the sun begun to break from the horizon (as I was travelling eastward), Galleon Ship entered. I stood there, all alone, watching a thousand-galleon ships sailing, &#8220;ghostly around the morning sun.&#8221;  I broke down. I was overwhelmed. It brought me to my knees. I was kneeling in the cockpit, in the twilight, moving slowly towards the sun, crying my heart out. The closest to a prayer a non-believer can experience.  And then of course, the way you have the album arranged, Ghosteen started speaking to me. I am beside you I am beside you Look for me  Suddenly everything made sense. I could physically sense and see the Ghosteen. Everyone singing to be free, broke free. I could almost physically sense all that has ever been, and all that will ever be. Everything had somehow clicked in my head. Loss was okay. It was only part of the game. The beauty of it all came in the foreground. I rose up and smiled at the emerging sun.  So I guess all I&#8217;m trying to say is this:  1) I want you to know I can see and sense the Ghosteen. It will be with me forever. Until I close my eyes.  2) Thank you.">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-1.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-1.png 830w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-1-250x166.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-1-768x509.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-1-700x464.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-1-120x80.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 830px) 100vw, 830px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Dear Stathis,</p>
<p>You Greeks are the best.</p>
<p>Love, Nick</p>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>

	</main>

Do you still believe that? <br> A sincere and devoted admirer of yours who sort of struggles in a content life.">‘In an interview from 1997 in Los Angeles, you introduced us to your &#8220;pet theory&#8221;: your creativity could only flourish in a state of loss and longing, and that it needed ...’</a></h5>

As a recovering heroin addict, I am having difficulty getting into the Narcotics Anonymous scene. I see how it can help but I feel as if many people replaced doing drugs with talking about when they used to do drugs. I am trying to find a good support system but it is hard. Perhaps I am being too cynical and not giving it a chance? Do you have any more advice for a recovering heroin user?">‘What do you think about NA? 		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1259" class="post-1259 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #118 / October 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					I&#8217;m thinking about having a child but everything looks so grim right now. What&#8217;s your advice?				</h1>
				<h3>POLIANA, AUCKLAND, NEW ZEALAND</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/im-thinking-about-having-a-child/" title="I&#8217;m thinking about having a child but everything looks so grim right now. What&#8217;s your advice?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1.png 828w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-250x214.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-768x657.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-700x599.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Picture-1-120x103.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 828px) 100vw, 828px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<div class="post__title-block">
<h1 class="post-title">It looks like your website is censoring people who ask about Israel. Wtf? </h1>
<h3>POLIANA, AUCKLAND, NEW ZEALAND</h3>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h1 class="post-title">Why are you playing in Israel?</h1>
<h3>POLIANA, AUCKLAND, NEW ZEALAND</h3>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<p>Dear Poliana,</p>
<p>Thank you for the many and varied letters you have sent to <em>The Red Hand Files</em>. They have not gone unnoticed, and it is always a pleasure to hear from you.</p>
<p>Personally, I think it would be a mistake not to have a baby because of Israel’s occupation of Palestine. I suspect in the long term you may live to regret that decision.</p>
<p>In my experience something can happen to a new parent, a perception shift, as they are absorbed into the strange and absolute universe of the child, where the problems of the outside world temporarily retreat. There can be, on a deep level, a radical softening of one’s adversarial or pessimistic position toward the world, as the baby reconfigures our understanding of it. Things look less grim.</p>
<p>This has certainly been the case for me. I would say that my own children have gone a long way toward amplifying and energising my understanding of the world’s potential. They have become bright windows through which I can imagine the world anew. Despite our perilous predicament, they have turned me into a cautious optimist, as I watch them go about making things better. There are many reasons people don’t have children, of course, but to choose not to have them as a reaction to the state of the world seems, to me, defeatist and sad.</p>
<p>As for your question on Israel, I will refer you to Issue #13 where I lay out my reasons for playing Israel — no need to do that again here, they’ve changed little. I can assure you, though, that there is no censorship of questions relating to Israel on my website, and this will be evidenced by the usual cascade of letters I will receive from the boycott advocates, after posting this Issue.</p>
<p>However, let me just say this. My music is not designed to reward people for good behaviour, nor do I make music to punish people for bad behaviour. My music is not conditional. It is for everybody, regardless of their actions, good or bad or otherwise. I hope my music has the capacity to advance the world in a positive direction. I say <em>my</em> music because I believe each musician should be afforded the respect to arrive at their own understanding of what the exact purpose of their music is. I make music in the hope that it improves matters, that it makes things better. Poliana, how I wish I could walk on stage again in front of an <em>actual crowd,</em> in Israel, or in New Zealand or anywhere else, and play — what an absolute privilege that would be.</p>
<p>Love, Nick</p>
</div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

	<main role="main" aria-label="Content">
	<!-- section -->
	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1255" class="post-1255 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #117 / September 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					Do you enjoy magic? Card tricks, stage illusions, that kind of thing.				</h1>
				<h3>RICHARD, LONDON, UK</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/do-you-enjoy-magic/" title="Do you enjoy magic? Card tricks, stage illusions, that kind of thing.">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-3.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-3.png 830w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-3-250x299.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-3-768x920.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-3-700x838.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-3-120x144.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 830px) 100vw, 830px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Dear Richard,</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Yes, I do have an interest in magic, or at least I used to. My boy, Arthur, became obsessed with it when he was about thirteen and for a year, maybe more, <em>all </em>he did was magic. Every day he sat around shuffling cards and flipping coins, and watching endless online magic tutorials and DVDs by his favourite magicians. He joined The Young Magicians Club at The Magic Circle and I would drive him around to magic shows and magician</span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">’</span><span lang="EN-US">s conventions and trade shows and magic shops. He practised and practised and became really good at it.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">In the summer of 2014, in Los Angeles, we spent much of our time down on Hollywood Blvd watching the street magicians, and Arthur would show them his magic tricks and they would show him theirs. We hung out at the Magic Castle every Saturday that summer, and entered this strange community of magicians, who taught Arthur the Classic Pass and the Double Turnover and the various coin tricks, and Arthur got so good at sleight of hand it seemed that there was nothing he couldn</span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">’</span><span lang="EN-US">t make disappear. </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Our dear friend Larry </span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">‘</span>Ratso<span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA"> ’</span><span lang="EN-US">Sloman, who wrote the definitive book on Harry Houdini, introduced us to the great David Blaine — we went to his house and Arthur showed him a couple of his tricks and David called Arthur </span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">‘</span><span lang="EN-US">a good magician</span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">’</span><span lang="EN-US">, then took out a deck of cards and completely blew our minds. Later on he gave Arthur the novel, Siddhartha, by Hermann Hesse, which Arthur never read, but kept next to his bed. </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Then one day, back in Brighton, Arthur just stopped doing magic completely. I asked him why and he just shrugged and said, </span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">“</span><span lang="EN-US">I don</span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">’</span><span lang="EN-US">t want to do it any more, dad</span>”<span lang="EN-US">, and that was the end of that — and, I suppose, the end of my active interest in magic, too.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Richard, I hope I</span><span dir="RTL" lang="AR-SA">’</span><span lang="EN-US">ve answered your question. I am sorry that maybe in the end these words are not addressed to you. Maybe these words are projected beyond this world, as a wish, as a prayer, as a sleight of hand, hoping they may draw the attention of the spirits themselves. Our boy, our magician, our vanisher — we miss you.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="NL">Love, Nick</span></p>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

Perhaps I am being too cynical and not giving it a chance? Do you have any more advice for a recovering heroin user?">‘What do you think about NA? 	<!-- section -->
	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1246" class="post-1246 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #116 / September 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					Nina Simone once said: Freedom means having no fear. Sometimes on stage, she added, she would reach that kind of state. How do you free yourself from fear?				</h1>
				<h3>TIM, BRUSSELS, BELGIUM</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/nina-simone-fear/" title="Nina Simone once said: Freedom means having no fear. Sometimes on stage, she added, she would reach that kind of state. How do you free yourself from fear?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rhf-116.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rhf-116.png 1188w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rhf-116-250x207.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rhf-116-768x635.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rhf-116-700x579.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rhf-116-120x99.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 1188px) 100vw, 1188px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p><span lang="EN-US">Dear Tim,</span></p>
<div>
<div></div>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Freedom for me is the ability to relinquish control of the outcome of things and so, in this respect, I agree with Nina Simone; it is to be delivered from fear. These are fraught times but, for me, meditation, the loss of my son, and even the fact that I am just getting older, has allowed me to arrive at a place where I do not feel at the mercy of consequence in the way that I used to — it doesn’t matter to me so much these days <em>what happens</em>. I feel that if I stay true to myself and follow my intuitions, if I surrender control of life’s outcomes, things tend to work out okay. On an artistic level, I play what I want to play, and say what I want to say, and let the chips fall where they may. This is a kind of freedom. As I have said before in </span><em><span lang="DE">The Red Hand Files</span></em><span lang="EN-US">, the universe has had its best shot at me and I am still kicking around. </span><em><span lang="DE">The Red Hand Files</span></em><span lang="EN-US"> have played a significant part in this feeling of resilience to the capricious and indifferent nature of the world, they have made me stronger. Each answer I write seems to be an act of surrender, but at the same time a kind of armouring up — vulnerability as a form of protection. </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Tim, your question, that came in today, was the 30,000<sup>th</sup> one. It is also two years this week since I started <em>The Red Hand Files</em> and I can’t tell you how much this means to me. On top of that, this week was my lovely wife’s birthday and also the funeral of my dear, dear mother. Thank you to the many people who offered their condolences at the loss of my mother and reminded me, over and over again, of her beautiful words — </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">“Head high and fuck ‘</span>em all!<span lang="EN-US">” </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">She was the greatest. </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="NL">Love, Nick</span></p>
<div></div>
</div>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

Perhaps I am being too cynical and not giving it a chance? Do you have any more advice for a recovering heroin user?">‘What do you think about NA? 		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1236" class="post-1236 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #115 / September 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
									</h1>
				<h3></h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/1236-2/" title="">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-2.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-2.png 828w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-2-250x420.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-2-768x1289.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-2-700x1175.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-2-120x201.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 828px) 100vw, 828px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>My beautiful mother passed gently away today. She was ninety-three years old. She was the most extraordinary woman and greatly loved. My family and I would like to thank the nurses at Cabrini Hospital in Brighton, Australia for their most wonderful care and kindness over the last few weeks.</p>
<p>Love, Nick</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>

	<body class="post-template-default single single-post postid-1231 single-format-standard anchor-grow-wings">
      <!-- Google Tag Manager (noscript) -->
<noscript><iframe src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/ns.html?id=GTM-5VFQT55"
height="0" width="0" style="display:none;visibility:hidden"></iframe></noscript>
<!-- End Google Tag Manager (noscript) -->
		<!-- wrapper -->
		<div class="wrapper">

			<!-- header -->
			<header class="header clear" role="banner">

					<!-- logo -->
					<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com"  class="logo">
						<!-- svg logo - toddmotto.com/mastering-svg-use-for-a-retina-web-fallbacks-with-png-script -->
						<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/themes/red-hand-files/dist/img/logo.svg" alt="Logo" class="logo__img">
						<span>The Red Hand Files</span>
					</a>
					<!-- /logo -->

					<!-- nav -->
					<nav class="nav" role="navigation">
						<a href="#" class="nav__burger"></a>
						<ul><li id="menu-item-11" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-11"><a href="http://theredhandfiles.com">The Files</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-12" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-12"><a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/ask-a-question/">Ask a Question</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-13" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-13"><a href="#subscribe">Subscribe</a></li>
</ul>					</nav>
					<!-- /nav -->

			</header>
			<!-- /header -->

	<main role="main" aria-label="Content">
	<!-- section -->
	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1231" class="post-1231 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #114 / September 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					If, for decades, an anchor served a ship, which one day decided to cut its chains and sail away, can the drowning anchor grow wings? And if so, will the anchor always be burdened by the weight of having been used?				</h1>
				<h3>TOM, TEL AVIV, ISRAEL</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/anchor-grow-wings/" title="If, for decades, an anchor served a ship, which one day decided to cut its chains and sail away, can the drowning anchor grow wings? And if so, will the anchor always be burdened by the weight of having been used?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-1.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-1.png 828w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-1-250x329.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-1-768x1011.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-1-700x921.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-1-120x158.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 828px) 100vw, 828px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<div>
<p>Dear Tom,</p>
<p>An anchor without a ship is just a useless lump of iron that lies at the bottom of the sea. An anchor serves no purpose once the ship has set sail.</p>
<p>In my song ‘Waiting for You’ I wrote —</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
</div>
<p>Your body is my anchor</p>
<p>I never asked to be freed</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>— and even though the context is different I understand the painful place you are in and I in no way want to diminish it, however, your current state is ultimately unsustainable and, well, seeing as we are dealing in metaphors there is no reason we can’t at least entertain the possibility that you might be a ship that just thinks it is an anchor.</p>
<p>The revealing part of your question is the last few words “burdened by the weight of <em>having been used</em>”. If you continue to see yourself in this self-defeating light, whether it is true or not, you will remain that twisted lump of metal at the bottom of the ocean.</p>
<p>My wish for you, my friend — and all the other abandoned anchors that write to me from the ocean floor — is that a time will come when you can reimagine yourself, not as the poor old stalwart anchor rusting on the sea bottom, but as a fucking ship and get back on the surface of the water and do what ships do — venture forth and begin again the strange, dangerous, <em>glorious,</em> storm-tossed voyage of life!</p>
<p>Love, Nick</p>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

Do you still believe that? <br> A sincere and devoted admirer of yours who sort of struggles in a content life.">‘In an interview from 1997 in Los Angeles, you introduced us to your &#8220;pet theory&#8221;: your creativity could only flourish in a state of loss and longing, and that it needed ...’</a></h5>
        </li>

I see how it can help but I feel as if many people replaced doing drugs with talking about when they used to do drugs. I am trying to find a good support system but it is hard. Perhaps I am being too cynical and not giving it a chance? Do you have any more advice for a recovering heroin user?">‘What do you think about NA? 		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1216" class="post-1216 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #113 / September 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					On The Lyre of Orpheus, the track Breathless moves me beyond words. In the intro every time I hear it I&#8217;m taken to a 14th or 16th century style ensemble. Is that the intention or can you explain where that comes from?				</h1>
				<h3>SCOTT, DUNEDIN, NEW ZEALAND</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/breathless-moves-me-beyond-words/" title="On The Lyre of Orpheus, the track Breathless moves me beyond words. In the intro every time I hear it I&#8217;m taken to a 14th or 16th century style ensemble. Is that the intention or can you explain where that comes from?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1.png 864w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-250x315.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-768x967.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-700x881.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-1-120x151.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 864px) 100vw, 864px" />							</a>
														<p style="text-align: center;">
							THE LYRE OF ORPHEUS 'IF YOU PLAY THAT FUCKING THING DOWN HERE...'							</p>
												<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<div>
<p>Dear Scott,</p>
<p>About thirty years ago, when Dirty Three were still playing the little clubs in Melbourne, Conway Savage, who was the newly appointed piano player in the Bad Seeds, was in the audience watching the band. He had not seen Dirty Three before, nor had he met Warren. In the song ‘Indian Love Song’ Warren played the flute.</p>
<p>Now, you must understand that Conway was a guy from an obscure town in rural Victoria called Fish Creek with a population of about ninety people and, at the time, his musical taste didn’t extend too far beyond traditional country and western music.</p>
<p>Conway introduced himself to Warren after the gig saying — “Good show, mate, but if I see you play that flute again I’ll ram it up your arse.”</p>
<p>So, Warren quietly put his flute away in its case and there it lay, untouched, for over a decade.</p>
<p>It’s 2004 and The Bad Seeds are in Ferber studios in Paris for the Abattoir Blues sessions. Warren is now in the band and we had just recorded the song ‘Breathless’, an upbeat number that begins —</p>
</div>
<pre><em>
It’s up in the morning and on the downs</em>

<em>Little white clouds like gambolling lambs</em>


</pre>
<div>
<p>Conway had done some lovely rollicking piano on it and gone back to the hotel.I felt that the song needed a solo instrument on the opening bars, so that the song began in a happy, life-affirming way, so I say to Warren — “Have you got a flute?”</p>
<p>Warren says — “Um, yes.”</p>
<p>I say — “I think this song needs some flute. Let’s put some on tomorrow.”</p>
<p>Warren says — “Well, we’d better do it in the morning before Conway comes in because he told me years ago that if I ever played the flute again he would ram it up my arse.”</p>
<p>So, the next day I set up a space for Warren to play the flute — a meditation cushion and a circle of scented candles and some incense and stuff like that.</p>
<p>Warren arrives with his flute and says — “Is Conway here?”</p>
<p>And I say — “No.”</p>
<p>So, Warren sits down on the cushion and we bring the lights down, put on ‘Breathless’, and Warren plays the flute on the introduction. Now, Warren hasn’t played the flute since Conway said he’d stick it up his arse, so Warren is more than a bit rusty and the flute sounds like shit. So we do it again.</p>
<p>I say to him — “Relax and play like a seven year old child that has just been given his first recorder.”</p>
<p>So Warren plays it again and it still sounds terrible. “Give me another go,” he says.</p>
<p>So Warren does, like, another ten takes and they each sound progressively worse than the one before. Warren does the Walk of Shame back into the control booth.</p>
<p>“The flute sounds like shit,” I say to Warren.</p>
<p>“Right,” says Warren.</p>
<p>“How about we listen to them all back at the same time,” I say.</p>
<p>Warren says — “And let’s put some of them backwards.”</p>
<p>And I say — “And let’s detune some of them and stick them through a phaser, and drench the whole thing in reverb.”</p>
<p>So, Nick Launay, the producer, messes around with the flute, and then plays all the takes back at the same time — some backwards, some detuned, some phased — and it sounds like an incredibly fucked-up 14<sup>th</sup> or 16<sup>th</sup> Century style ensemble, as you say, Scott. Warren has a big smile on his face.</p>
<p>“Beautiful,” he says.</p>
<p>Then Conway comes in.</p>
<p>Conway sits down, lights a cigarette, opens a beer, listens for a bit and says — “Is that a flute?”</p>
<p>Warren says in a small voice — “No.”</p>
<p>May 2017 and we are in Brooklyn for rehearsals for the American <em>Skeleton Tree</em> tour. Conway collapses in the lobby of the One Hotel and is rushed to hospital, where he undergoes emergency surgery to remove a tumour from his brain. Conway remains in hospital and we head off on tour without him.</p>
<p>After the tour, there is a letter waiting for Warren back home in Paris. The letter reads —</p>
<p>“Warren, I was wrong about the flute. Conway.”</p>
<p>Though Conway’s operation was a success, it was a short reprieve — Conway would never tour with the Bad Seeds again and a year later, on this day in 2018, Conway passed away taking the ramshackle soul of the Bad Seeds with him.</p>
<p>People often ask me if I miss past members of the Bad Seeds and the answer is, ‘Well, not really.’ But I miss Conway. We all miss Conway. We miss him a lot. Things are not the same without him.</p>
<p>Just as an aside. Back in 2004, we released Breathless as a single, but the BBC radio refused to play it. They loved the song but they didn’t like the flute. Our record company at the time recalled the song and removed the flute. The BBC played it. It was a flop.</p>
<p>Love, Nick</p>
</div>
<div></div>
<div><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-1217" src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-2-250x155.png" alt="" width="250" height="155" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-2-250x155.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-2-768x477.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-2-700x435.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-2-120x75.png 120w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Picture-2.png 830w" sizes="(max-width: 250px) 100vw, 250px" /></div>
<div style="text-align: center;">CONWAY SAVAGE 1960 &#8211; 2018</div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1208" class="post-1208 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #112 / August 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					I spent the day watching Bad Seed TeeVee and the fan cover versions of your songs are amazing. How will you choose a winner?				</h1>
				<h3>KATHY, ARIZONA, USA</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/how-will-you-choose-a-winner/" title="I spent the day watching Bad Seed TeeVee and the fan cover versions of your songs are amazing. How will you choose a winner?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-3.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-3.png 830w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-3-250x299.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-3-768x920.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-3-700x838.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-3-120x144.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 830px) 100vw, 830px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<div class="post__title-block">
<h1 class="post-title">How are you going to pick one of the covers? I think they&#8217;re all terrific. What trouble have you got into, dear Nick?</h1>
<h3>NATASHA, BUENOS AIRES, ARGENTINA</h3>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<p>Dear Natasha and Kathy,I was absolutely blown away. Seriously. The cover versions were awesome. Many of them, as far as I am concerned, were glorious advancements on the originals. Maria Højrup’s gorgeous Bright Horses, the operatic Avalanche, Saint Agnes’ chilling and superior No Pussy Blues and Asa’s Loverman-riot, the absolutely epic Galleon Ship and the super-disturbing Jack the Ripper, that seriously great Higgs Boson Blues from Ladyship Warship — wow, the rendition of Wild Rose (finally in tune), and the beautiful Covid-harp version, the Watching Alice snuff video, Paul at the piano playing Push the Sky Away, the kid singing We No Who U R on the acoustic guitar in the Clash t-shirt, and many other lovely versions of this song, the truly celestial Girl in Amber — so beautiful,  the cool aborted country version of Loverman, the couple singing Henry Lee in Italian, the woman singing a weird and wonderful Far From Me, the Kubrick/Clément West Country Girl, the consistently exquisite genius of Gelareh Pour — we are simply not worthy, my dear, and poor Woody still in the bath, the cutest duet of People Ain’t No Good ever, the guy in his kitchen in his socks playing a radically lovely interpretation of O Children and Nick and Yana’s super-eerie version of the same song, the deeply enchanting I Let Love In and the full-on version, the brilliantly evil Up Jumped the Devil, the Dead Writers’ astonishing Are You the One That I’ve Been Waiting For? and the instrumental version, the lovely Stranger Than Kindness dance-with-the–devil-mini-movie, the girl playing the joyful, kamikaze version of Good, Good Day — a personal favourite, the girl singing Henry Lee with the flowers in her hair, the handsome guys playing More News from Nowhere in their shed, the Serbian ukulele Mercy Seat, the sultry Shivers, the unbelievably brave version of From Her to Eternity from the girl sitting on the floor, Jake Shane who takes Fireflies and totally claims it as his own, Tom Rabu’s superlative, amputated We No Who U R and Jubilee Street instrumental — my God!, and the epic guitar version of the same song, the hard rock Fifteen Feet of Pure White Snow, complete with Moog synthesizer solo, the loneliest and most sublime No More Shall We Part ever,  the country Love Letter, the many gorgeous Into My Arms, the cool kid playing O Children on the unplugged electric guitar, the hysterical Lay Me Low, the devotional Bless His Ever Loving Heart, Straight to You in a gold cape, the girl singing an unearthly reworking of Skeleton Tree and Till Otte’s chilling version of the same song, the dreamy Push the Sky Away, the awesome Swedish Mercy Seat, the seriously pissed-off, wigged-out Christina the Astonishing, the satanic Song of Joy, a whole bunch of different people finally doing something cool with Red Right Hand, including PJ Brown and the D minor matchbox girl, and Ptolemy, of course, the goose-bumpy version of Hold Onto Yourself — a song I haven’t heard for years, the joyous Brompton Oratory trio, the mighty Sadegh’s Palaces of Montezuma and the funky version and the version in the club, the two girls’ well-needed reworking of The Weeping Song and The Weeping Song in a room of lights, the wonderful Cleopatra  Weeping Song, the baptismal Weeping Song, and all the other Weeping Songs, the spooked-out Man in the Moon, the crystalline, heart-stopping Sun Forest, the intense Dig, Lazarus, Dig!!!, the punk-rock Idiot Prayer in a hazmat suit, Scott Casuccio’s ethereal voice, the acapella Push the Sky Away, the guy fucking going for it with O My Lord, the live Ship Song, the Loom of the Land duet, the nervy ‘solo’ Stagger Lee, Tino pouring his heart out, the groovy Lime Tree Arbour, the gorgeous candle-lit No More Shall We Part, the eerie version at the piano, and the super-groovy and drugged-out Messiah Ward, Herbert’s Wonderful Life, Joel’s awesome, other-worldly speak-song version of I had a Dream, Joe, the father singing Waiting For You with his son — Jesus, I wasn’t prepared for that — and then the girl playing it on the upright — wow, the fucked-up Nick the Stripper with the horse’s head, the wild version of Brother My Cup is Empty from Buenos Aires, the lovely God is in the House from Luiz Rocha, and on and on it went.</p>
<p>But there were two songs, both off Ghosteen that, for me, stopped time itself. The deeply moving version of Spinning Song by Ilya Gruzdev, with its extraordinarily affecting home video footage, was such a strange, bold and emotional elevation of the original. I loved this. Watching it, well, it was very hard for me to keep my shit together.</p>
<p>And the other song, Waiting For You by Juldiz, with its incredibly haunting video, felt like it was attached by the tips of its fingers to the very edge of the world and could float away at any moment. It really was one of the most beautiful and precarious musical moments I have heard in a very long time. It was a performance that emerged deep within the song itself, on that delicious brink of collapse where so much great art lives, beamed from a million sorrowing miles away. Unbelievably beautiful.</p>
<p>Like I said, I was very affected by what I saw this weekend. We all were, I think, based on the love and support from the Bad Seed community in the comments section of the Vortex. There have been a lot of cover versions of my songs over the years, but rarely have I heard them played with such honesty, understanding, creativity, conviction and pure heart. This stuff is the real deal and exactly what music should be about. Thank you all so much. It was an honour to be a part of it.</p>
<div>Love, Nick</div>
</div>
</div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

			<!-- header -->
			<header class="header clear" role="banner">

					<!-- logo -->
					<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com"  class="logo">
						<!-- svg logo - toddmotto.com/mastering-svg-use-for-a-retina-web-fallbacks-with-png-script -->
						<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/themes/red-hand-files/dist/img/logo.svg" alt="Logo" class="logo__img">
						<span>The Red Hand Files</span>
					</a>
					<!-- /logo -->

					<!-- nav -->
					<nav class="nav" role="navigation">
						<a href="#" class="nav__burger"></a>
						<ul><li id="menu-item-11" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-11"><a href="http://theredhandfiles.com">The Files</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-12" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-12"><a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/ask-a-question/">Ask a Question</a></li>

			</header>
			<!-- /header -->

	<main role="main" aria-label="Content">
	<!-- section -->
	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1198" class="post-1198 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #111 / August 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					Rather than ask you a question, I&#8217;d like to ask you to do something. I think you&#8217;ll be touched by this story, and the part you play in it. Please take a look. <br><br> https://www.abc.net.au/news/2020-08-19/non-verbal-teen-tyler-hartfield-writes-nick-cave-inspired-song/12555074 <br><br> Thanks for inspiring.				</h1>
				<h3>NIC, DENMARK, AUSTRALIA</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/i-think-youll-be-touched-by-this-story/" title="Rather than ask you a question, I&#8217;d like to ask you to do something. I think you&#8217;ll be touched by this story, and the part you play in it. Please take a look.  https://www.abc.net.au/news/2020-08-19/non-verbal-teen-tyler-hartfield-writes-nick-cave-inspired-song/12555074  Thanks for inspiring.">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-2.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-2.png 830w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-2-250x299.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-2-768x920.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-2-700x838.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-2-120x144.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 830px) 100vw, 830px" />							</a>
														<p style="text-align: center;">
							TYLER HARTFIELD							</p>
												<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p>Dear Nic,</p>
<p>This is so good. The band are great. I love the slow crawl of the song, the backing vocals coming in half way, and everything kicking in at 3:15. Genuinely thrilling.</p>
<p>And Tyler’s writing is something else.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><em>‘The wolf who wins?</em></p>
<p><em>The one you feed’</em></p>
<p><em> </em></p>
<p>— is about as smart and as true as something can be, and the final verse</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><em>&#8216;Playing on my heartstrings</em></p>
<p><em>You never pour your picky jealousy</em></p>
<p><em>Onto my growing love for you</em></p>
<p><em>Help me beat my way to you&#8217;</em></p>
<p><em> </em></p>
<p>— is as good as it gets. That last line!</p>
<p><em> </em></p>
<p><em>‘Help me beat my way to you’</em></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Wow!</p>
<p>Love, Nick</p>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

				<h2>Issue #110 / August 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					Is it true that Kanye&#8217;s new album is delayed because you both took the last minute decision to include a track you have been working on together?				</h1>
				<h3>VASSILIS, BRUSSELS, BELGIUM</h3>

													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/is-it-true-that-kanyes-new-album-is-delayed-because/" title="Is it true that Kanye&#8217;s new album is delayed because you both took the last minute decision to include a track you have been working on together?">

					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>

	</section>

	</main>

	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1185" class="post-1185 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #109 / August 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					What is mercy for you?				</h1>
				<h3>VALERIO, TURIN, ITALY</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/what-is-mercy-for-you/" title="What is mercy for you?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-1.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-1.png 896w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-1-250x189.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-1-768x579.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-1-700x528.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-1-120x91.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 896px) 100vw, 896px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<div class="post__title-block">
<h1 class="post-title">What do you think of cancel culture?</h1>
<h3>FRANCES, LOS ANGELES, USA</h3>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<p>Dear Valerio and Frances,</p>
<p>Mercy is a value that should be at the heart of any functioning and tolerant society. Mercy ultimately acknowledges that we are all imperfect and in doing so allows us the oxygen to breathe — to feel protected within a society, through our mutual fallibility. Without mercy a society loses its soul, and devours itself.</p>
<p>Mercy allows us the ability to engage openly in free-ranging conversation — an expansion of collective discovery toward a common good. If mercy is our guide we have a safety net of mutual consideration, and we can, to quote Oscar Wilde, “play gracefully with ideas.”</p>
<p>Yet mercy is not a given. It is a value we must nurture and aspire to. Tolerance allows the spirit of enquiry the confidence to roam freely, to make mistakes, to self-correct, to be bold, to dare to doubt and in the process to chance upon new and more advanced ideas. Without mercy society grows inflexible, fearful, vindictive and humourless.</p>
<p>Frances, you’ve asked about cancel culture. As far as I can see, cancel culture is mercy’s antithesis. Political correctness has grown to become the unhappiest religion in the world. Its once honourable attempt to reimagine our society in a more equitable way now embodies all the worst aspects that religion has to offer (and none of the beauty) — moral certainty and self-righteousness shorn even of the capacity for redemption. It has become quite literally, bad religion run amuck.</p>
<p>Cancel culture’s refusal to engage with uncomfortable ideas has an asphyxiating effect on the creative soul of a society. Compassion is the primary experience — the heart event — out of which emerges the genius and generosity of the imagination. Creativity is an act of love that can knock up against our most foundational beliefs, and in doing so brings forth fresh ways of seeing the world. This is both the function and glory of art and ideas. A force that finds its meaning in the cancellation of these difficult ideas hampers the creative spirit of a society and strikes at the complex and diverse nature of its culture.</p>
<p>But this is where we are. We are a culture in transition, and it may be that we are heading toward a more equal society — I don’t know — but what essential values will we forfeit in the process?</p>
<p>Love, Nick</p>
</div>
</div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

	<!-- section -->
	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1178" class="post-1178 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #108 / August 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					What do you do when the lyrics just aren&#8217;t coming?				</h1>
				<h3>MARKO, ZAGREB, CROATIA</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/the-lyrics-just-arent-coming/" title="What do you do when the lyrics just aren&#8217;t coming?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1.png 846w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-250x366.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-768x1124.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-700x1024.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Picture-1-120x176.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 846px) 100vw, 846px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p>Dear Marko,</p>
<p>In my experience, lyrics are almost always seemingly <em>just not coming</em>. This is the tearful ground zero of song writing — at least for some of us. This lack of motion, this sense of suspended powerlessness, can feel extraordinarily desperate for a songwriter. But the thing you must hold on to through these difficult periods, as hard as it may be, is this — <em>when something’s not coming, it’s coming</em>. It took me many years to learn this, and to this day I have trouble remembering it.</p>
<p>The idea of lyrics ‘not coming’ is basically a category error. What we are talking about is not a period of ‘not coming’ but a period of ‘not arriving’. The lyrics are always coming. They are always pending. They are always on their way toward us. But often they must journey a great distance and over vast stretches of time to get there. They advance through the rugged terrains of lived experience, battling to arrive at the end of our pen. In time, they emerge, leaping free of the unknown — from memory or, more thrillingly, from the predictive part of our minds that exists on the far side of the lived moment. It has been a long and arduous journey, and our waiting much anguished.</p>
<p>Marko, our task is both simple and extremely difficult. Our task is to remain patient and vigilant and to not lose heart — for we are the destination. We are the portals from which the idea explodes, forced forth by its yearning to arrive. We are the revelators, the living instruments through which the idea announces itself — the flourishing and the blooming — but we are also the waiting and the wondering and the worrying. We are all of these things — we are the songwriters.</p>
<p>Love, Nick</p>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>
