	<main role="main" aria-label="Content">
	<!-- section -->
	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1058" class="post-1058 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #94 / April 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					I recently read that the band Rising Signs believed &#8216;Palaces of Montezuma&#8217; plagiarized their 2005 song, &#8216;Grey Man.&#8217; Sure, I can hear similarities in melody, but, oddly, I think one of many reasons I love &#8216;Palaces&#8217; is that it reminds me, if anything, of the intro to &#8216;Theme From Mad Flies, Mad Flies&#8217; by The Laughing Clowns from 1982. I&#8217;m not sure what that says about Rising Signs, but it made me wonder &#8211; [ ] Is originality in music sometimes hard to obtain?				</h1>
				<h3>ELSE, PORTLAND, USA</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/originality-hard-to-obtain/" title="I recently read that the band Rising Signs believed &#8216;Palaces of Montezuma&#8217; plagiarized their 2005 song, &#8216;Grey Man.&#8217; Sure, I can hear similarities in melody, but, oddly, I think one of many reasons I love &#8216;Palaces&#8217; is that it reminds me, if anything, of the intro to &#8216;Theme From Mad Flies, Mad Flies&#8217; by The Laughing Clowns from 1982. I&#8217;m not sure what that says about Rising Signs, but it made me wonder &#8211; [ ] Is originality in music sometimes hard to obtain?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-3.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-3.png 864w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-3-250x266.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-3-768x816.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-3-700x744.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-3-120x128.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 864px) 100vw, 864px" />							</a>
														<p style="text-align: center;">
							THE LAUGHING CLOWNS - ED KUEPPER AND THE MIGHTY JEFFREY WEGENER							</p>
												<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Dear Else,</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">A lovely question, and one that brings us back to </span>‘<span lang="EN-US">Palaces of Montezuma.</span>’ <span lang="EN-US">If I recall correctly, Warren wrote the chords and backing vocal line to this song. I just listened to Rising Signs</span>&#8216; ‘Grey Man’ <span lang="EN-US">and it does sound pretty fucking similar. So, I phoned Warren, who is in lockdown in his studio in Paris, and asked him outright —</span></p>
<p class="Body">“<span lang="EN-US">Did you steal </span>‘<span lang="EN-US">Palaces of Montezuma</span>’ <span lang="EN-US">from Rising Signs?</span>”</p>
<p class="Body">“Fuck, no!” <span lang="EN-US">he says, </span>“<span lang="EN-US">I stole it from The Laughing Clowns.</span>”</p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">The great beauty of contemporary music, and what gives it its edge and vitality, is its devil-may-care attitude toward appropriation — everybody is grabbing stuff from everybody else, <em>all the time</em>. It</span>’<span lang="EN-US">s a feeding frenzy of borrowed ideas that goes toward the advancement of rock music — the great artistic experiment of our era.  </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Plagiarism is an ugly word for what, in rock and roll, is a natural and necessary — even admirable — tendency, and that is to steal.</span> <span lang="EN-US">Theft is the engine of progress, and should be encouraged, even celebrated, provided the stolen idea has been advanced in some way. To advance an idea is to steal something from someone and make it so cool and covetable that someone then steals it from you. In this way, modern music progresses, collecting ideas, and mutating and transforming as it goes.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">But a word of caution, if you steal an idea and demean or diminish it, you are committing a dire crime for which you will pay a terrible price — whatever talents you may have will, in time, abandon you. If you steal, you must honour the action, further the idea, or be damned.  </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">So, </span>‘<span lang="EN-US">Deanna</span>’<span lang="EN-US"> is based on </span>‘<span lang="EN-US">Oh Happy Day</span>’<span lang="EN-US">, and the solo in the middle of </span>‘<span lang="EN-US">Red Right Hand</span>’ <span lang="EN-US">may well have been stolen from </span>‘Bedazzled’<span lang="EN-US">, and </span>‘<span lang="PT">Tupelo</span>’ <span lang="EN-US">leans heavily on John Lee Hooker</span>’<span lang="EN-US">s song by the same name, and the theme from </span>‘<span lang="EN-US">The Road</span>’ <span lang="EN-US">sounds like the arpeggio work of Arvo P</span>ä<span lang="EN-US">rt, and the guitar riff in </span>‘Nobody’s Baby Now’ <span lang="EN-US">probably came straight out of a Van Morrison tune and, well, &#8216;Palaces of Montezuma&#8217;, it turns out, is based on a song by The Laughing Clowns, and so it goes — ideas, beautiful ideas, in full flow. Even though the influences may seem obvious, each of these songs, I think, has its own ingenuity, its own value and its own meaning. We musicians all stand on the shoulders of each other, our pirate pockets rattling with booty, our heads exploding with repurposed ideas. </span></p>
<p class="Body">“<span lang="EN-US">What else have you stolen?</span>” <span lang="EN-US">I ask Warren.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><em>“</em><em><span lang="EN-US">Everything,</span></em><em>”</em><span lang="EN-US"> he says, </span>“<span lang="EN-US">Absolutely, <em>everything.</em></span>”</p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="NL">Love, Nick </span></p>
<div></div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1054" class="post-1054 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #93 / April 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					What inspired the lyrics for Palaces of Montezuma?				</h1>
				<h3>SUE, DONCASTER, UK</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/what-inspired-palaces-of-montezuma/" title="What inspired the lyrics for Palaces of Montezuma?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-2.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-2.png 841w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-2-250x316.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-2-768x970.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-2-700x884.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-2-120x152.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 841px) 100vw, 841px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Dear Sue, </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">I love </span>‘<span lang="EN-US">Palaces of Montezuma</span>’<span lang="EN-US">. I really do. Amid all the obvious excesses of Grinderman, this song stands out as a simple and heartfelt declaration of human love, with a surreal and wonderfully fucked up lyric. It has a sort of versatile inner spirit that seems to work in any form.  I played it a number of times, solo at the piano, on my In Conversations tour — I was able to slow it down a bit and lean into the lyric and that seemed to work great too. I got to know the song pretty well. </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">But even so, I</span>’<span lang="EN-US">m not really sure what inspired the lyric. It</span>’<span lang="EN-US">s not the sort of question I feel I have the authority to answer. These songs, you know, just present themselves. It seems to me to be essentially a cascade of increasingly bizarre and impossible acts of largesse, performed in the name of love. It seems to say, </span>“<span lang="EN-US">I love you and I will give you the world — all I require is the smallest word.</span>” <span lang="EN-US">What that word actually is remains a mystery — it may be<em> love </em></span>or <em><span lang="EN-US">sex </span></em>or <em>God</em><span lang="EN-US"> or </span><em>yes</em><span lang="EN-US"> or <em>thou</em> or </span><em>all </em><span lang="EN-US">— or not a word at all — a sigh — a grace. Whatever the word may be, it is essentially the whole world </span>“<em><span lang="EN-US">contained in a grain of sand — that can barely walk, can</span></em><em>’</em><em><span lang="EN-US">t even stand</span></em><em>”.</em><span lang="EN-US"> I suspect this idea may have migrated across time, and eventually found its way into the song </span>‘Ghosteen’, “<em><span lang="EN-US">There is nothing wrong with loving things that cannot even stand</span></em>.” <span lang="EN-US">I don</span>’<span lang="EN-US">t know. Just a thought. These ideas are wayfaring enigmas, for sure.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">I just put </span>‘<span lang="EN-US">Palaces of Montezuma</span>’ <span lang="EN-US">on the record player and had a listen </span>and<span lang="EN-US">, hearing it again after so long, something occurred to me. I can</span>’<span lang="EN-US">t help but think that the song was helped along its way by the sweetly loony Lou Reed song, </span>‘Andy’<span lang="EN-US">s Chest</span>’, <span lang="EN-US">from his album, </span><em>Transformer</em><span lang="EN-US">. Perhaps that was the initial point of inspiration. I</span>’<span lang="EN-US">m not sure. I hope so. I love Lou Reed. I really do.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="NL">Love, Nick</span></p>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1049" class="post-1049 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #92 / April 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					A Prayer to who?				</h1>
				<h3>PATRICK, MELBOURNE, AUSTRALIA</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/a-prayer-to-who/" title="A Prayer to who?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-1.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-1.png 864w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-1-250x187.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-1-768x573.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-1-700x523.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Picture-1-1-120x90.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 864px) 100vw, 864px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<div>
<p><span class="mc-toc-title">Dear Patrick,</span></p>
<p>The act of prayer is by no means exclusive to religious practise because prayer is not dependent on the existence of a subject. You need not pray <em>to </em>anyone. It is just as valuable to pray into your disbelief, as it is to pray into your belief, for prayer is not an encounter with an external agent, rather it is an encounter with oneself. There is as much chance of our prayers being answered by a God that exists as a God that doesn’t. I do not mean this facetiously, for prayers are very often answered.</p>
<p>A prayer provides us with a moment in time where we can contemplate the things that are important to us, and this watchful application of our attention can manifest these essential needs. The act of prayer asks of us something and by doing so delivers much in return — it asks us to present ourselves to the unknown as we are, devoid of pretence and affectation, and to contemplate exactly what it is we love or cherish. Through this conversation with our inner self we confront the nature of our own existence.</p>
<p>The coronavirus has brought us to our knees, yet it has also presented us with the opportunity to be prayerful, whether we believe in God or not. By forcing us into isolation, it has dismantled our constructed selves, by challenging our presumed needs, our desires, and our ambitions and rendered us raw, essential and reflective. Our sudden dislocation has thrown us into a mystery that exists at the edge of tears and revelation, for none of us knows what tomorrow will bring.</p>
<p>In our hubris we thought we knew, but as we bow our heads within the virus’ awesome power, all we are sure of now is our defencelessness. In the end this vulnerability may be, for our planet and ourselves, our saving grace, as we step chastened into tomorrow. Released from our certitude, we present our purest offering to the world — our prayers.</p>
<p>Love, Nick</p>
</div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1035" class="post-1035 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #91 / April 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					I&#8217;ve been listening to Bob Dylan&#8217;s new song for most of the day. I can&#8217;t shake it. Can&#8217;t grasp it. It makes me wince and laugh and then, every time, it makes me cry. I think it might be a masterpiece. Do you like it?				</h1>
				<h3>DOUGLAS, GLASGOW, SCOTLAND</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/bob-dylans-new-song/" title="I&#8217;ve been listening to Bob Dylan&#8217;s new song for most of the day. I can&#8217;t shake it. Can&#8217;t grasp it. It makes me wince and laugh and then, every time, it makes me cry. I think it might be a masterpiece. Do you like it?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/bob-dylan-press-fbcover.jpg" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/bob-dylan-press-fbcover.jpg 849w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/bob-dylan-press-fbcover-150x150.jpg 150w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/bob-dylan-press-fbcover-250x250.jpg 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/bob-dylan-press-fbcover-768x767.jpg 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/bob-dylan-press-fbcover-700x699.jpg 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/bob-dylan-press-fbcover-120x120.jpg 120w" sizes="(max-width: 849px) 100vw, 849px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<div class="post__title-block">
<h1 class="post-title">I am really loving the new Bob Dylan song Murder Most Foul. I wonder if you&#8217;ve heard it and if so what do you think?</h1>
<h3>DAVID, NORWICH, UK</h3>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h1 class="post-title">Do you think that the new Bob Dylan song feels like a swan song? Do you think it is the last song we will hear from him?</h1>
<h3>EMILIA, ANTWERP, BRUSSELS</h3>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h1 class="post-title">I am trying to read more poetry lately in isolation. Can you suggest a poet or poem?</h1>
<h3>ANNIE, LOS ANGELES, USA</h3>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<p>Dear Douglas, David, Emilia and Annie,</p>
<p>Many other people have also written in about Bob Dylan’s new song, ‘Murder Most Foul’ — and the interest is justifiable. It is a perplexing but beautiful song and, like many people, I have been extremely moved by it.</p>
<p>At the heart of this seventeen-minute epic is a terrible event, the assassination of JFK — a dark vortex that threatens to pull everything into it, just as it did in the USA back in 1963. Whirling around the incident Dylan weaves a litany of loved things — music mostly — that reach into the darkness, in deliverance. As the song unfolds he throws down lifeline after lifeline, insistent and mantra-like, and we are lifted, at least momentarily, free of the event. Dylan’s relentless cascade of song references points to our potential as human beings to create beautiful things, even in the face of our own capacity for malevolence. ‘Murder Most Foul’ reminds us that all is not lost, as the song itself becomes a lifeline thrown into our current predicament.</p>
<p>The instrumentation is formless and fluid and very beautiful. Lyrically it has all the perverse daring and playfulness of many of Dylan’s great songs, but beyond that there is something within his voice that feels extraordinarily comforting, especially at this moment. It is as though it has travelled a great distance, through stretches of time, full of an earned integrity and stature that soothes in the way of a lullaby, a chant, or a prayer.</p>
<p>As for whether this is the last time we will hear a new Bob Dylan song. I certainly hope not. But perhaps there is some wisdom in treating all songs, or for that matter, all experiences, with a certain care and reverence, as if encountering these things for the last time. I say this not just in the light of the novel coronavirus, rather that it is an eloquent way to lead one’s life and to appreciate the here and now, by savouring it as if it were for the last time. To have a drink with a friend as if it were the last time, to eat with your family as it were the last time, to read to your child as if it were the last time, or indeed, to sit in the kitchen listening to a new Bob Dylan song as if it were the last time. It permeates all that we do with greater meaning, placing us within the present, our uncertain future, temporarily arrested.</p>
<p>Annie, I was reading a poem today which very much resonates — it is by the beloved English poet Stevie Smith, who has given me much pleasure over the years.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>I Do Not Speak</strong></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>I do not ask for mercy for understanding for peace</p>
<p>And in these heavy days I do not ask for release</p>
<p>I do not ask that suffering shall cease</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>I do not pray to God to let me die</p>
<p>To give an ear attentive to my cry</p>
<p>To pause in his marching and not hurry by</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>I do not ask for anything I do not speak</p>
<p>I do not question and I do not seek</p>
<p>I used to in the day when I was weak</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Now I am strong and lapped in sorrow</p>
<p>As in a coat of magic mail and borrow</p>
<p>For Time today and care not for tomorrow</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Much love, Nick</p>
</div>
</div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1029" class="post-1029 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #90 / March 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					What are your plans for the corona pandemic? What do you intend to do to fill the time? A solo performance from home on the piano?				</h1>
				<h3>ALICE, OSLO, NORWAY</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/corona-fill-the-time/" title="What are your plans for the corona pandemic? What do you intend to do to fill the time? A solo performance from home on the piano?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-3.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-3.png 804w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-3-250x433.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-3-768x1329.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-3-700x1211.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-3-120x208.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 804px) 100vw, 804px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<div class="post__title-block">
<h1 class="post-title">Have you and the band thought about live streaming a concert at some point? It could really help people feel connected during this time. </h1>
<h3>HENRY, SYDNEY, AUSTRALIA</h3>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h1 class="post-title">What does a person who isn&#8217;t particularly creative do in isolation? I haven&#8217;t got a clue.</h1>
<h3>SASKIA, LONDON, UK</h3>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Dear Alice, Henry and Saskia,</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">My response to a crisis has always been to create. This impulse has saved me many times — when things got bad I</span>’d <span lang="EN-US">plan a </span><span lang="EN-US">tour, or write a book, or make a record — </span>I’<span lang="EN-US">d hide myself</span><span lang="EN-US"> in </span><span lang="EN-US">work, and try to stay</span><span lang="EN-US"> one step ahead of whatever it was that was pursuing me. So, when it became clear that The Bad Seeds would have to postpone the European tour and that I would have, at the very least, three months of sudden spare time, my mind jumped into overdrive with ideas of how to fill that </span><span lang="EN-US">space. On a video call with</span><span lang="EN-US"> my team we threw ideas around — stream a solo performance from my home, write an isolation album, write </span><span lang="EN-US">an online</span><span lang="EN-US"> corona diary, write an apocalyptic film </span><span lang="EN-US">script, create </span>a <span lang="EN-US">pandemic</span> <span lang="EN-US">playlist on Spotify</span><span lang="EN-US">, start an online reading </span><span lang="EN-US">club, answer </span><span lang="DE">Red</span><span lang="DE"> Hand Files </span><span lang="FR">questions </span><span lang="FR">live</span><span lang="EN-US"> online,</span><span lang="EN-US"> stream a songwriting tutorial, or a cooking programme, etc. — all with the aim to keep my creative momentum going, and to give my self-isolating fans something to do.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">That night, as I contemplated </span><span lang="EN-US">these ideas,</span><span lang="EN-US"> I began</span><span lang="EN-US"> to think about what I had done in the last three months — working with Warren and the Sydney Symphony Orchestra, planning and mounting a massive and incredibly complex Nick Cave exhibition with </span><span lang="EN-US">the Royal Danish Library, putting together the Stranger Than Kindness book,</span><span lang="EN-US"> working on an updated </span><span lang="EN-US">edition of my &#8220;Collected Lyrics&#8221;</span>, <span lang="EN-US">developing the show for the Ghosteen world tour</span><span lang="EN-US"> (which, by the way, will be fucking mind-blowing if we ever get to do it!), </span><span lang="EN-US">working on a second</span><span lang="EN-US"> B Sides and Rarities record and, of course, reading and </span><span lang="EN-US">writing T</span><span lang="DE">he Red Hand</span><span lang="DE"> Files</span><span lang="DE">. </span><span lang="EN-US">As I sat there in bed and reflected</span>,<span lang="EN-US"> another thought presented itself, clear and wondrous and humane —</span><s> </s></p>
<p class="Body"><em><span lang="EN-US">Why is this the time to get creative?</span></em></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Together we have stepped into history and are now living inside an event unprecedented in our lifetime. </span><span lang="EN-US">Every day the</span><span lang="EN-US"> news provides us with dizzying information that a few weeks before would have been unthinkable. What deranged and divided us a month ago seems</span><span lang="EN-US">,</span> <span lang="DA">at best</span><span lang="EN-US">, an</span><span lang="EN-US"> embarrassment from an idle and privileged time. We have become eyewitnesses to a catastrophe that we are seeing unfold from the inside out. We are forced to isolate — to be vigilant, to be quiet, to watch and </span><span lang="EN-US">contemplate the possible </span><span lang="PT">implosion</span><span lang="EN-US"> of our civilisation</span> <span lang="EN-US">in real time</span><span lang="EN-US">. When we eventually step clear of this moment we will have discovered things about our leaders, our societal systems, our friends, our enemies and most of all, </span><span lang="EN-US">ourselves. We will know something of our resilience, our capacity for forgiveness, and our mutual vulnerability. Perhaps</span><span lang="EN-US">, it is a time to pay attention, to be mindful, to be observant.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">As an artist, it feels inapt to miss this extraordinary moment. </span><span lang="EN-US">Suddenly, the acts of writing a novel, or a screenplay or a series of songs seem like indulgences from a bygone </span><span lang="PT">era. </span><span lang="EN-US">For me, this is not a time to be buried in the business of creating. It is a time to tak</span><span lang="EN-US">e a backseat and use this opportunity to reflect on exactly what our </span><span lang="EN-US">function is — what we, as artists, are <em>for</em>.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Saskia, there are other</span> f<span lang="EN-US">orms of</span><span lang="EN-US"> engagement, open to us all. An email to a distant friend, a phone call to a parent or sibling, a kind word to a neighbour, a prayer for those working on the front lines.</span><span lang="EN-US"> These simple gestures can bind the world together — throwing threads of love here and there, ultimately connecting us all — so that when we do emerge from this moment we are unified by compassion, humility and a greater dignity. Perhaps, we will also see the world through different eyes, with an awakened reverence for the wondrous thing that it is. This could, indeed, be the truest creative work of all.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="NL">Love, Nick x</span></p>
<div></div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->

As a recovering heroin addict, I am having difficulty getting into the Narcotics Anonymous scene. I see how it can help but I feel as if many people replaced doing drugs with talking about when they used to do drugs. I am trying to find a good support system but it is hard. Perhaps I am being too cynical and not giving it a chance? Do you have any more advice for a recovering heroin user?">‘What do you think about NA? 	<main role="main" aria-label="Content">
	<!-- section -->
	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1023" class="post-1023 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #89 / March 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					What do we do now?				</h1>
				<h3>JOHN, LONDON, UK</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/what-do-we-do-now/" title="What do we do now?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-2.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-2.png 862w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-2-250x211.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-2-768x650.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-2-700x592.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-2-120x101.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 862px) 100vw, 862px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">The Red Hand Files has always been a space in which I could offer dubious existential </span><span lang="EN-US">notions, religious meditations, unsound advice, millennial senilities and general annoyances, while hopefully simultaneously extending a little human kindness and compassion. However, these sorts of ruminations came from a more privileged and fortunate time, when we had the oxygen to muse and to play. Things have changed, we are faced with a common enemy — impartial, unfeeling and of immeasurable magnitude — and it is no longer a time for abstractions. </span><span lang="EN-US">Now is the time to be cautious with our words, our opinions. </span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">A friend called </span><span lang="EN-US">our new world ‘a ghost ship’ — and maybe she is right. </span><span lang="EN-US">S</span><span lang="IT">he ha</span><span lang="EN-US">s recently lost someone dear to her and recognises acutely the premonitory feeling </span><span lang="EN-US">of a world about to be shattered — and </span><span lang="EN-US">that we will need to put ourselves back together again, not only personally, but societally. In time we will be given the opportunity to either contract around the old version of ourselves and our world — insular, self-interested and tribalistic — or understand the connectedness and commonality of all humans, everywhere. In isolation, we will be presented with our essence — of what we are personally and what we are as a society. We will be asked to decide what we want to preserve about our world and ourselves, and what we want to discard. </span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">Eventually these questions will become of acute significance, but they are not for now. Now is a time to listen to those in more informed positions and to follow instructions, as difficult as that may be, as we step into the unprecedented unknowable. We should be careful about the noises we make — especially those with a public voice — and should not pretend to know what we do not. From within the clamour and tonnage of information and misinformation, of opinions and counter-opinions, of blame-games and grim prophecy and the most panic-inducing version of ‘Imagine’ ever recorded, emerges a simple message — wash your hands and (if you can) stay at home.</span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">Love, Nick</span></p>
<div></div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1018" class="post-1018 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #88 / March 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					I know it is hard to know, but please give us a hint on the tour in regards of the Corona virus. What is the latest you know? What are the risks of the tour being postponed? It would be sad if this is the case, but please know that we fans would support such a decision, no matter how hard it is to wait even longer to see you and the Bad Seeds.				</h1>
				<h3>MIKE, STOCKHOLM, SWEDEN</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/tour-corona-virus/" title="I know it is hard to know, but please give us a hint on the tour in regards of the Corona virus. What is the latest you know? What are the risks of the tour being postponed? It would be sad if this is the case, but please know that we fans would support such a decision, no matter how hard it is to wait even longer to see you and the Bad Seeds.">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-1.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-1.png 860w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-1-250x118.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-1-768x363.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-1-700x330.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-1-120x57.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 860px) 100vw, 860px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Dear Mike </span><span lang="EN-US">and everyone else who has asked</span><span lang="EN-US"> this question,</span></p>
<p><span lang="EN-US">It has been a very strange few weeks, much has happened to us all, and many difficult decisions have had to be made. Slowly, we all are coming around to the realisation that we will need to lead very different lives for a while — short term, long </span><span lang="EN-US">term, who</span><span lang="EN-US"> knows?</span></p>
<p>One very hard question that The Bad Seeds have had <span lang="EN-US">to answer is </span><span lang="FR">regard</span><span lang="EN-US">ing </span><span lang="FR">our </span><span lang="EN-US">touring plans this year</span><span lang="EN-US">. With great disappointment and sadness we made the decision to postpone the UK, Europe and Israel tour, which seems, as far as I can see, the only responsible course of action. I am very sorry. More details will be posted on nickcave.</span><span lang="EN-US">com once the new plan settles.</span></p>
<p><span lang="EN-US">I am working on a more personal response to the hundreds of questions that are coming in regarding the coronavirus. This will take a little time. It</span>’<span lang="EN-US">s a hard question to answer. </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Love, Nick.</span></p>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1015" class="post-1015 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #87 / March 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					What is your favourite moment from the Bible?				</h1>
				<h3>NICCOLÒ, NOVARA, ITALY</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/favourite-moment-the-bible/" title="What is your favourite moment from the Bible?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1.png 848w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-250x277.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-768x850.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-700x774.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-120x133.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 848px) 100vw, 848px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">Dear Niccolò,</span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">When Jesus was taken down from the cross, his body laid in a tomb and a stone rolled across the entrance, his twelve male disciples essentially fled. Mary Magdalene did not. In Matthew 27:61 it says —</span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><em><span lang="EN-US">“Mary Magdalene and the other Mary remained standing there in front of the tomb.”</span></em></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">I think this haunted single sentence is probably my favourite moment from the Bible.</span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">Misjudged by history, her fundamental importance in the Christian story undermined by the religious patriarchy, Mary Magdalene nevertheless remains the subversive nucleus around which the Gospel story revolves.</span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">Mary Magdalene is the most moving symbol of true and resilient love, both earthly and spiritual. She ‘remains standing’ at the entrance of the tomb, the primary witness between two monumental events — the crucifixion and the resurrection — that have imprinted themselves upon history and fashioned not just Western thinking but the very essence of what we are, whether we like it or not. Mary Magdalene, forever standing at the mouth of the tomb in steadfast vigil, gazing out of history, is embedded in our subconscious. She is the true icon of feminine grief — complex, elemental, patient, empathetic and full of sorrowing wonder, and a manifestation of both physical and transcendent love — the true human hero of the Christian story. </span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">Love, Nick</span></p>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

	<!-- section -->
	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-1008" class="post-1008 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #86 / March 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					Do you ever feel the need to change lyrics, when performing live, which may be problematic in 2020, for example &#8220;a fag in a whalebone corset dragging his dick across my cheek&#8221;? Or are you happy to preserve the lyric as a product of its time, and respect the original content?				</h1>
				<h3>GAVIN, DUBLIN, IRELAND</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/do-you-need-to-change-lyrics/" title="Do you ever feel the need to change lyrics, when performing live, which may be problematic in 2020, for example &#8220;a fag in a whalebone corset dragging his dick across my cheek&#8221;? Or are you happy to preserve the lyric as a product of its time, and respect the original content?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-copy.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-copy.png 834w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-copy-250x349.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-copy-768x1072.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-copy-700x977.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Picture-1-copy-120x167.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 834px) 100vw, 834px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Dear Gavin, </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">These days, some of my songs are feeling a little nervous. They are like children that have been playing cheerfully in the schoolyard, only to be told that all along they have had some hideous physical deformity. Their little hearts sink and they piss their pants. They leave the playground burning with shame, as a scornful, self-righteous future turns around with its stone and takes aim. </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">But what songwriter could have predicted thirty years ago that the future would lose its sense of humour, its sense of playfulness, its sense of context, nuance and irony, and fall into the hands of a perpetually pissed off coterie of pearl-clutchers? How were we to know? </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Perhaps we writers should have been more careful with our words &#8211; I can own this, and I may even agree &#8211; however, we should never blame the songs themselves. Songs are divinely constituted organisms. They have their own integrity. As flawed as they may be, the souls of the songs must be protected at all costs. They must be allowed to exist in all their aberrant horror, unmolested by these strident advocates of the innocuous, even if just as some indication that the world has moved toward a better, fairer and more sensitive place. If punishment must be administered, punish the creators, not the songs. We can handle it. I would rather be remembered for writing something that was discomforting or offensive, than to be forgotten for writing something bloodless and bland. </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Love, Nick</span></p>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-999" class="post-999 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #85 / February 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					Who is the &#8216;Girl in Amber&#8217;?				</h1>
				<h3>JOSCHA, HÜNXE, GERMANY</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/who-is-the-girl-in-amber/" title="Who is the &#8216;Girl in Amber&#8217;?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-2.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-2.png 860w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-2-250x353.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-2-768x1084.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-2-700x988.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-2-120x169.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 860px) 100vw, 860px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<div class="post__title-block">
<h1 class="post-title">&#8216;Girl in Amber&#8217; is about your grief, right? I know Skeleton Tree was largely written before, but I can&#8217;t help but wonder.</h1>
<h3>KEVIN, BARKING, UK</h3>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h1 class="post-title">Please tell us something about &#8216;Girl in Amber&#8217;?</h1>
<h3>SOMEBODY, VALID COUNTRY</h3>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h1 class="post-title">&#8216;Girl in Amber&#8217; brings me to tears and I have no idea why. What is the story behind this song?</h1>
<h3>SAMANTHA, NIEUWEGEIN, HOLLAND</h3>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h1 class="post-title">I just want to express my gratitude for &#8216;Girl in Amber&#8217;. I have never really felt anything which expressed my feelings about the death of my daughter, but this song does somehow. It has had a cathartic and necessary effect on me for which I am thankful.</h1>
<h3>LIZ, SUNSHINE COAST, AUSTRALIA</h3>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Dear Joscha, Kevin, Somebody, Samantha and Liz,</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">‘Girl in Amber’ is a song wrapped around a mystery. It is a song that formed itself as if from a dream and it seems to possess a special, almost mystical, power.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Back in 2014, I was sitting at Warren’s kitchen table after a day of making music in his little studio at the back of his house in Paris. On the table was a paperweight with a spider trapped inside, and the title ‘Girl in Amber’ slipped into my mind. I remember feeling happy, because I rarely get given titles for songs — the title almost </span><em><span lang="EN-US">always </span></em><span lang="EN-US">comes after a long struggle with the words — and this one seemed alive with meaning. It made me think of people I knew who were in a state of stasis, forever locked in the past, but it was not about anyone in particular. Or so I thought. </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">I recorded a version of the song that day, improvising the repetitive, mantra-like lyric, and then forgot about it.</span></p>
<p class="Body" style="text-align: center;"><span lang="EN-US">***</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">A year or so later, I was in another studio in Paris attempting to finish Skeleton Tree. Things had changed. Arthur, my son, had died a few months earlier and I was existing in a kind of fugue-state, numbly sitting in the studio listening to the songs, trying to make sense of the material we had been working on over the last year, and as I listened to the version of ‘Girl in Amber’, I was completely overwhelmed by what I heard.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">It was suddenly and tragically clear that ‘Girl in Amber’ had found its ‘</span><em><span lang="EN-US">who’</span></em><span lang="EN-US">. The ‘who’ was Susie, my wife — held impossibly, as she was at the time, within her grief, reliving each day a relentless spinning song that began with the ringing of the phone and ended with the collapse of her world. The eerie, death-obsessed second verse seemed to speak directly to me, and I added the half-line ‘Your little blue-eyed boy’, but left the rest of the verse as it was. There were a couple of lines in the song that made little sense, but I left them unchanged for they brought a fractured inarticulateness to the lyric, which added to its mysterious, emotional pull. I added the line ‘Don’t touch me’ in the mixing session some months later. It felt true.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">In 1998, I wrote in a lecture called </span><em><span lang="EN-US">The Secret Life of the Love Song</span></em><span lang="EN-US"> about the strange, second sight that certain songs seemed to have, and certainly there are a number of songs on </span><em><span lang="EN-US">Skeleton Tree</span></em><span lang="EN-US"> that appeared to speak into the future, but nothing as acutely and tragically as ‘Girl in Amber’. ‘Girl in Amber’ seemed to possess an uncanny clairvoyance, a secret intelligence — the song was already deep in mourning before the tragedy had occurred.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">When I sang ‘Girl in Amber’ on the </span><em><span lang="EN-US">Skeleton Tree </span></em><span lang="EN-US">tour, it felt very much as if I was singing into the terrible present — my wife still trapped in the amber of her grief. Last month I performed it on the </span><em><span lang="EN-US">In Conversation </span></em><span lang="EN-US">tour. Three years had gone by and it struck me as I sang it, alone at the piano, that I was speaking to the past, and that Susie had been released, at least in part, from the suffocating darkness that surrounded her. There was some air and some light between her and the world. Time had done its work.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Liz, I would like to think that ‘Girl in Amber’ went some way toward releasing both my wife and me from the paralysis of our grief, as you suggest it helped you. I would also add that it has been my experience that although we are all, in some way or another, imprisoned by the events of our seemingly intractable pasts, in time, patient time, we heal. </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Love, Nick</span></p>
<div></div>
<div></div>

As a recovering heroin addict, I am having difficulty getting into the Narcotics Anonymous scene. I see how it can help but I feel as if many people replaced doing drugs with talking about when they used to do drugs. I am trying to find a good support system but it is hard. Perhaps I am being too cynical and not giving it a chance? Do you have any more advice for a recovering heroin user?">‘What do you think about NA? 		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-978" class="post-978 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #84 / February 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					Tell us a joke.				</h1>
				<h3>JOSEPH, DEN HAAG, NETHERLANDS</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/tell-us-a-joke/" title="Tell us a joke.">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-NEW-1.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-NEW-1.png 864w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-NEW-1-250x375.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-NEW-1-768x1151.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-NEW-1-700x1049.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-NEW-1-120x180.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 864px) 100vw, 864px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<p>Dear Joseph,</p>
<p>No, but Juan will.</p>
<p>Love, Nick</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<div class="post__title-block">
<h1 class="post-title" style="text-align: center;">Do you often think of the circumstances of your death, Nick? I do. When I die, I wanna die peacefully like my Grandpa did, in his sleep, and not screaming and cursing like all the passengers in his car.</h1>
<h3>JUAN, ALICANTE, SPAIN</h3>
</div>
<div>
<p style="text-align: left;">Dear Juan,</p>
<p style="text-align: left;">This is the 20,000<sup>th</sup> question to The Red Hand Files. It is also the funniest. I am sending it out to the world as an act of mercy and although I don’t think about the circumstances of my death too much, I hope I’ll go with as much joy and humour in my heart as I had upon reading your question. You are a beautiful human being and thank you for the many letters you have sent.</p>
<p style="text-align: left;">Love, Nick</p>
</div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

	<!-- section -->
	<section>

	
		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-969" class="post-969 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #83 / February 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					Have you ever considered playing in far away countries in Middle East or somewhere? You have a fanbase here in Iran, you might wonder! Although it is forbidden for &#8220;Western artists&#8221; to play here in Iran, I hope you play in Turkey again so we get the chance to see you! And I hope that someday artists raise their voice for their fans in oppressed countries rather than banning concerts somewhere!  Your biggest fan, from distant skies!				</h1>
				<h3>SADEGH, MASHHAD, IRAN</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/have-you-considered-playing-in-middle-east/" title="Have you ever considered playing in far away countries in Middle East or somewhere? You have a fanbase here in Iran, you might wonder! Although it is forbidden for &#8220;Western artists&#8221; to play here in Iran, I hope you play in Turkey again so we get the chance to see you! And I hope that someday artists raise their voice for their fans in oppressed countries rather than banning concerts somewhere!  Your biggest fan, from distant skies!">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-1.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-1.png 864w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-1-250x333.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-1-768x1022.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-1-700x932.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-1-120x160.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 864px) 100vw, 864px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<div>
<p>Dear Sadegh,</p>
<p>Some years ago my dear friend, Arash from Tehran sent me a link to the movie, <em>No One Knows About Persian Cats.</em> This has to be one of the great rock ‘n’ roll movies of all time. Courageous, funny, dangerous, heart-breaking yet ultimately uplifting, it shows, as clear as any movie I can think of, the pure subversive force of rock ‘n’ roll, its incredible resilience, its unifying power and its transcendent nature. The extraordinary lengths the musicians go to in order to play their music, despite the grotesque and repressive nature of the regime, is truly inspiring.</p>
<p>I receive a lot of letters from Iran on <em>The Red Hand Files</em> and it is a genuine sadness for us that we are unable to play in your country. I hope one day that will change. There appears to be an ever-growing hunger in Iran to resist these oppressive measures and stand up for basic freedoms, artistic or otherwise. I wish you all the best in that struggle.</p>
<p>Of course, there are paternalistic and authoritarian forces that exist everywhere, to a greater or lesser degree; these come in a variety of different guises, always in the name of some greater virtue, yet always with the same intent — to silence musicians and free expression. We must, of course, resist.</p>
<p>The good news, however, is that it looks like The Bad Seeds will be playing in Istanbul next year, and if it is anything like the show we did there in 2018, it&#8217;s going to be a blast. It was a special time for us. Email me your address, Sadegh, and we can arrange tickets for the show. The Bad Seeds and I will be happy to see you, although it is sad you have to come so far.</p>
<p>Love, Nick</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
</div>
<div></div>
<div></div>
<div><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-971" src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-2-1-250x333.png" alt="" width="225" height="300" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-2-1-250x333.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-2-1-768x1022.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-2-1-700x932.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-2-1-120x160.png 120w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-2-1.png 864w" sizes="(max-width: 225px) 100vw, 225px" /></div>
<div></div>
<div>PICTURES FROM <em>NO ONE KNOWS ABOUT PERSIAN CATS</em></div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-963" class="post-963 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #82 / February 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					I just met a guy who has completely the opposite political beliefs to me but I really like him. Are we doomed?				</h1>
				<h3>EVIE, BIRMINGHAM, UK</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/are-we-doomed/" title="I just met a guy who has completely the opposite political beliefs to me but I really like him. Are we doomed?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1.png 862w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-250x200.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-768x614.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-700x560.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-1-120x96.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 862px) 100vw, 862px" />							</a>
														<p style="text-align: center;">
							THE SENSATIONAL ALEX HARVEY BAND - 1974							</p>
												<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<div class="post__title-block">
<h1 class="post-title">The Sensational Alex Harvey Band are the uncrowned kings of 70&#8217;s rock. Do you agree?</h1>
<h3>JONE, EGERSUND, NORWAY</h3>
</div>
<div>
<div><span lang="EN-US">Dear Evie and Jone, </span></div>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">Evie, in no way are you doomed! Who</span><span lang="EN-US"> wants to hang out with someone who </span><em><span lang="EN-US">agrees with you </span></em><span lang="EN-US">all the time? A certain friction is essential, and disagreement and mutual forgiveness can become the measure of an interesting and durable relationship.</span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">I am </span><span lang="EN-US">reminded of my long</span><span lang="EN-US"> friendship with Bobby Gillespie. Now, there is much we don’t agree on politically, however it has done nothing to affect our relationship, other than to energise it, I think. And not everything is politics</span><span lang="EN-US">. At the end of the day, there</span><span lang="EN-US"> is always </span><em><span lang="EN-US">The Sensational Alex Harvey Band!</span></em></p>
<p class="BodyA" style="text-align: left;"><span lang="EN-US">Here is a text </span><span lang="EN-US">exchange between Bobby and me from</span><span lang="EN-US"> June 2018.</span></p>
<p class="BodyA" style="text-align: center;"><span lang="EN-US">* * *</span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">N: I’ve been stranded in Porto airport for hours. Nothing is happening. I want to shoot myself.</span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span lang="EN-US">B: This will cheer you up.</span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="Hyperlink0"><span lang="EN-US"><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YRbfFZnJZYQ" target="_blank" rel="noopener" data-cke-saved-href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YRbfFZnJZYQ">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YRbfFZnJZYQ</a></span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: Fuck! I’ve never seen that! My first band was basically an Alex Harvey cover band. We did Framed, Isobel Goudie, Faith Healer, Gang Bang, Next, Midnight Moses, everything. I wore jeans and a tight cropped t-shirt and our guitarist wore clown make-up like Zal.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">B: I love that u guys loved Alex Harvey. He did an interview before punk where he said that rock music had become stale and needed high-energy (my words) bands to rise up and blow away the old guard.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: He was the greatest.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">B: He was so loved in Glasgow. His ‘Delilah’ was murderous.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: Our first gig was a Battle of the Bands thing in a country town and we played ‘Framed’ and came second. It’s been downhill ever since. </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">B: Do you have a recording?</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: No. His version of ‘Next’ was the greatest, by a million miles. </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">B: It’s fantastic. I borrowed that album as a teen and that track blew my mind. “The first taste of</span></span> <span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">Gonorrhea”</span></span><span class="None"><span lang="IT">. Amazing.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: Such fucking venom. As a kid in Australia I could never understand why Alex Harvey sang in such a bizarre way – the way he pronounced his words – I never knew about Scottishness. Then I met you and it all made sense!</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">B: Ha! Glaswegian.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: Exactly!!</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">B: It’s an exclusive dialect.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: You’re fucking telling me!</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">B: He couldn’t have come from Edinburgh. </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: It’s impenetrable. </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">B: Unintelligible. Probably just as well! I’ll teach you.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: Took me literally years to work out what you were saying!</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">B: Thank God. I may have been a wee bit smashed.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: You’re officially forgiven.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">B: Thank u Father. Check this out. Pure evil.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="Hyperlink0"><span lang="EN-US"><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R861Dw30_Ds" target="_blank" rel="noopener" data-cke-saved-href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R861Dw30_Ds">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R861Dw30_Ds</a></span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: I am inspired!</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">B: Thought you might be.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: Getting on the plane.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">B: So dark. Safe flight.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: Very dark.</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="PT">B: Vambo</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US"> </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">N: Coming to the rescue! </span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA" style="text-align: center;"><span class="None"><span lang="EN-US">* * *</span></span></p>
<p class="BodyA"><span class="None"><span lang="NL">Love, Nick </span></span></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-965" src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-2-250x401.png" alt="" width="187" height="300" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-2-250x401.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-2-768x1233.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-2-700x1124.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-2-120x193.png 120w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Picture-2.png 824w" sizes="(max-width: 187px) 100vw, 187px" /></p>
<div></div>
</div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>
<div id="recent-posts-4" class="widget_recent_entries"><h3>Recent Posts</h3>      <ul>
                
        <li>
          <h4><a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/cope-with-negative-energy/">Issue #122</a><br>-</h4>
          <h5><a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/cope-with-negative-energy/" title="In this time of illness, cynicism and cruelty, do you receive many mean or vile messages? How do you cope with that kind of negative energy?">‘In this time of illness, cynicism and cruelty, do you receive many mean or vile messages? How do you cope with that kind of negative energy?’</a></h5>
        </li>
                
        <li>
          <h4><a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/pet-theory-your-creativity-flourish/">Issue #121</a><br>-</h4>
          <h5><a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/pet-theory-your-creativity-flourish/" title="In an interview from 1997 in Los Angeles, you introduced us to your &#8220;pet theory&#8221;: your creativity could only flourish in a state of loss and longing, and that it needed catastrophes in your life. <br> Finally, and this is what resonated with me the most, you stated that you could not get much substance out of living a life which was content. Do you still believe that? <br> A sincere and devoted admirer of yours who sort of struggles in a content life.">‘In an interview from 1997 in Los Angeles, you introduced us to your &#8220;pet theory&#8221;: your creativity could only flourish in a state of loss and longing, and that it needed ...’</a></h5>
        </li>
                
        <li>
          <h4><a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/what-do-you-think-about-na/">Issue #120</a><br>-</h4>
          <h5><a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/what-do-you-think-about-na/" title="What do you think about NA? As a recovering heroin addict, I am having difficulty getting into the Narcotics Anonymous scene. I see how it can help but I feel as if many people replaced doing drugs with talking about when they used to do drugs. I am trying to find a good support system but it is hard. Perhaps I am being too cynical and not giving it a chance? Do you have any more advice for a recovering heroin user?">‘What do you think about NA? As a recovering heroin addict, I am having difficulty getting into the Narcotics Anonymous scene. I see how it can help but I feel ...’</a></h5>
        </li>
              </ul>

		<!-- article -->
		<article id="post-955" class="post-955 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-uncategorised">
			<!-- post title -->
			<div class="post__title-block">
				<h2>Issue #81 / January 2020</h2>
				<h1 class='post-title'>
					Do you need to be hurt or mentally ill to be a great artist?				</h1>
				<h3>LATABAN, ENSENADA, MEXICO</h3>
			</div>
			<!-- /post title -->
			<div class="article">
				<div>
					<div class="article__sidebar">
						<!-- post thumbnail -->
													<a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/do-you-need-to-be-hurt-or-mentally-ill-to-be-a-great-artist/" title="Do you need to be hurt or mentally ill to be a great artist?">
								<img src="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Picture-1-3.png" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Picture-1-3.png 864w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Picture-1-3-250x299.png 250w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Picture-1-3-768x918.png 768w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Picture-1-3-700x837.png 700w, https://www.theredhandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Picture-1-3-120x143.png 120w" sizes="(max-width: 864px) 100vw, 864px" />							</a>
													<!-- /post thumbnail -->
						
											</div>
				</div>
				<div>

					<div class="post__title-block">
<h1 class="post-title">What makes a great song?</h1>
<h3>MILA, AMSTERDAM, HOLLAND</h3>
</div>
<div>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Dear Lataban and Mila,</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">It seems to me that many of the great artists, especially in music, appear to possess a wildly conflicted sense of themselves, yet persistently pursue their own uniqueness, even when it runs at odds with the orthodoxies of the day. They tend to be outliers, abyss-gazers and misfits, whose sense of isolation is further amplified by their notoriety, and who use their art as a way of connecting to people and legitimising their own strangeness. They understand, on some level, that it is the nature of their vocation to steal across the borders of convention, collect up ideas and bring them back to the world. This requires a certain reckless spirit and it may be that some spend too long on </span><span lang="EN-US">the other side</span> <span lang="EN-US">and that it becomes difficult for them to return. However, whether any of this is actual mental illness, I don</span>’<span lang="EN-US">t know. This term feels too elastic, too nebulous to comment. </span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Whether being hurt is a necessary requirement to creativity is only true in so much as to </span><em><span lang="DA">live</span></em><span lang="EN-US"> is partly to suffer. You cannot create without suffering, because you cannot live without suffering. One of the jobs of a songwriter, as I see it, is to develop strategies to help people transcend their sorrows. This is the unique duality of a great song &#8211; that it can reflect back at the listener the extent of their own hurt, yet lift them beyond it at the same time. How often have we wept ourselves to transcendence through music?</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="EN-US">Part of the process for the songwriter is to stay alert to the nature of their own wounds without indulging them, to gravitate towards happiness when possible, to venture beyond convention and acceptability without losing oneself, to understand that our most treasured beliefs exist on the far side of what we think we know, and to go there cautiously, yet fearlessly and, perhaps most importantly of all, to remember to return.</span></p>
<p class="Body"><span lang="NL">Love, Nick </span></p>
<div></div>
</div>
					<p>&nbsp;</p>
					<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="/ask-a-question" class="button">Ask a Question</a></p>
									</div>
			</div>

		</article>
		<!-- /article -->

	
	
	</section>
	<!-- /section -->
	</main>

        </li>

          <h4><a href="https://www.theredhandfiles.com/pet-theory-your-creativity-flourish/">Issue #121</a><br>-</h4>

As a recovering heroin addict, I am having difficulty getting into the Narcotics Anonymous scene. I see how it can help but I feel as if many people replaced doing drugs with talking about when they used to do drugs. I am trying to find a good support system but it is hard. Perhaps I am being too cynical and not giving it a chance? Do you have any more advice for a recovering heroin user?">‘What do you think about NA? 		<title>Nick Cave - The Red Hand File - Issue #80 - It&#039;s fucking hard to write to Nick Cave. I&#039;m currently (and have been for the past 9 years) emulating your rock n&#039; roll persona in a Nick Cave tribute band. I dress up like you (a cheap version, no stylist, can&#039;t find a shirt like yours) and in a shamanistic way recreate your live performances, sometimes succeeding to trick the audience into a feeling of being nearer to you. I&#039;m sorry if you feel I am a vampire sucking on you, but I&#039;m not ready to &quot;do my own thing&quot;. In the name of the Cave Dogs (the tribute band from Serbia, not the power pop band from Boston) I have to ask you if you know of us, and what do you think of us? : The Red Hand Files</title>
